subject: Re: [junit] RE: [java-gui-testing] test-running extensions, was: JUnit extra
msgSnippet: ... That s surprising, since it gives you an open listener architecture. You can do anything with it. What do you need that it doesn t support? I admit that a
messageBody:
Dennis N. Stetsenko wrote:

> Tom,
>
> junit-addon was the first tool I've take a look at. Unfortunately it is
> not even close to the task I'm solving.

That's surprising, since it gives you an open listener architecture. You
can do anything with it. What do you need that it doesn't support?

I admit that a custom <junit> formatter is a good solution, but please
be careful about saying in public that a tool is "not even close" when
the pieces are all there. :)
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
